channel.title: Installing Java - Simple Guide With Easy Steps
channel.description:
1.Make a file named: [code] javainst [/code] On the desktop
2.Download JDK 5.0 Update 8 from: [code] http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp [/code] Agree the terms and choose your OS.
3.Put it in the [code] javainst [/code] folder and now open up: [code] Control Panel >Preformance and Maitnance> System > Enviromental Variables. [/code]
4.
you have to set 'path'. add 'path' variable to system variables of your system. and set the value of the variable as [code]c:\j2sdk1.4.1\bin[/code] or the path to the /bin in the JDK file.
5.Download Textpad into the: [code] javainst [/code] file and install.Wait for the JDK to finishdownloading and install that too.
6.Open up Textpad and type in:
[code] public class HelloWorld {
public static void main(String args[]) { System.out.println("Installation Complete!"); } } [/code]
Save as HelloWorld.java and go to tools then compile.After thats done click on run application.
Credits to me.

item.title: Installing Java - Simple Guide With Easy Steps
item.dc:creator: @Stork Stork
item.description:
@Stork wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:5, topic:15342”][quote author=Stork link=topic=22848.msg261229#msg261229 date=1158841252]
Personally, I’d install Mustang… Much nicer lafs and it’s supposedly faster too.
[/quote]It’s still in Beta stages, no?[/quote]
Yep. Still very impressive. Especially the new LAFs

Read full topic

It doesn’t setup the EVs.

item.title: Installing Java - Simple Guide With Easy Steps
item.dc:creator: @iwasinmoparseas101cl iwasinmoparseas101class
item.description:
@iwasinmoparseas101cl wrote:

why not just download the binary files and the .exe file for offline installation so it does everything for you? And instead of using TextPad for your coding, why not use Eclipse or BlueJay or something that has an actual UI and can highlight errors so you can save time debugging?

Read full topic
item.source: Installing Java - Simple Guide With Easy Steps

item.title: Installing Java - Simple Guide With Easy Steps
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

1.Make a file named:

javainst

On the desktop

2.Download JDK 5.0 Update 8 from:

http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp

Agree the terms and choose your OS.

3.Put it in the

javainst

folder and now open up:

Control Panel >Preformance and Maitnance> System > Enviromental Variables.

you have to set ‘path’.
add ‘path’ variable to system variables of your system.
and set the value of the variable as

c:\j2sdk1.4.1\bin

or the path to the /bin in the JDK file.

5.Download Textpad into the:

javainst

file and install.Wait for the JDK to finishdownloading and install that too.

6.Open up Textpad and type in:

public class HelloWorld {

       public static void main(String args[]) {
         System.out.println("Installation Complete!");
      }
   }

Save as HelloWorld.java and go to tools then compile.After thats done click on run application.

Credits to me.

Read full topic
